channel.title: PM2.5 on Environment & Health Data Portal
channel.description: Recent content in PM2.5 on Environment & Health Data Portal

item.title: Tracking changes in New York City's sources of air pollution
item.description: As city life changes, so does its air quality, as sources of emissions that affect the city’s outdoor air quality, like truck traffic, building boilers and restaurants, also change. For more than a decade, we have been tracking air quality through the NYC Community Air Survey (NYCCAS) and exploring the factors that drive neighborhood differences. We have found some interesting changes in the sources of air pollution across NYC neighborhoods.

item.title: Breathe easy: NYC's air quality is improving
item.description: The air we breathe can have a major effect on our health — air pollution can make asthma worse and can cause heart disease, lung disease, strokes, and even cancer. Fortunately, New York City has made great strides in recent years to improve air quality.
